org.dancres.blitz.jini.lockmgr

Interface LockManager

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    DistributedLockManager

    public interface LockManager
    LockManager represents generic lock manager that allows obtaining and releasing locks on objects.
    Author:
    Roman Rokytskyy (rrokytskyy@acm.org)

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void delete(Object lockId, long aTimeout)
      Delete a resource held against a particular lock id.
      Serializable getResource(Object lockId) 
      void insert(Object lockId, long aTimeout, Serializable aResource)
      Store a resource against a particular lock id for later recovery via getResource.
      void lock(Object obj, Object owner, long timeout, Transaction aTxn)
      Obtain lock on obj for specified owner.
      void unlock(Object obj, Object owner, Transaction aTxn)
      Release lock on obj owned by specified owner.

    • Method Detail

      • lock

        void lock(Object obj,
        Object owner,
        long timeout,
        Transaction aTxn)
          throws org.jgroups.blocks.LockNotGrantedException,
                 org.jgroups.ChannelException
        Obtain lock on obj for specified owner. Implementation should try to obtain lock few times within the specified timeout.
        Parameters:
        obj - obj to lock, usually not full object but object's ID.
        owner - object identifying entity that will own the lock.
        timeout - maximum time that we grant to obtain a lock.
        aTxn - the transaction to take this lock under
        Throws:
        org.jgroups.blocks.LockNotGrantedException - if lock is not granted within specified period.
        ClassCastException - if obj and/or owner is not of type that implementation expects to get (for example, when distributed lock manager obtains non-serializable obj or owner).
        org.jgroups.ChannelException - if something bad happened to communication channel.

      • insert

        void insert(Object lockId,
          long aTimeout,
          Serializable aResource)
            throws org.jgroups.blocks.LockNotGrantedException,
                   org.jgroups.ChannelException

        Store a resource against a particular lock id for later recovery via getResource.

        Note insert will fail if a lock is currently held or is about to be asserted against that id.

        Throws:
        org.jgroups.blocks.LockNotGrantedException
        org.jgroups.ChannelException

      • delete

        void delete(Object lockId,
          long aTimeout)
            throws org.jgroups.blocks.LockNotReleasedException,
                   org.jgroups.ChannelException

        Delete a resource held against a particular lock id.

        This operation will fail whilst a lock is actively held against the lock id.

        Throws:
        org.jgroups.blocks.LockNotReleasedException
        org.jgroups.ChannelException

      • getResource

        Serializable getResource(Object lockId)

      • unlock

        void unlock(Object obj,
          Object owner,
          Transaction aTxn)
            throws org.jgroups.blocks.LockNotReleasedException,
                   org.jgroups.ChannelException
        Release lock on obj owned by specified owner.
        Parameters:
        obj - obj to lock, usually not full object but object's ID.
        owner - object identifying entity that will own the lock.
        Throws:
        org.jgroups.blocks.LockNotReleasedException - if lock is owned by another object.
        ClassCastException - if obj and/or owner is not of type that implementation expects to get (for example, when distributed lock manager obtains non-serializable obj or owner).
        org.jgroups.ChannelException - if something bad happened to communication channel.
